answers.answer: Addiontal info.  The hospitals in my area, does not have an endocronologist.  The closest one is 30-40 miles away at a different hospital.The hospital I attend now, has a primary doctor & surgeon treating my thyroid condition.  Can any other type of doctor or specialist treat thyroid conditions ?Thanks
An ENT surgeon may see your point of view, but it would almost surely require a consult with an Endo first. An Endo that specializes in thyroids, not diabetes.I'd find and Endo.
Don't let distance stop you. Get yourself to the Endo- they'll have the expertise to advise you.Em

question: I have an enlarged goiter and 3 additional nodules.  My thyroid function has been tested several times, results always normal.  But I feel miserable, mostly exhaustion, shaky, etc.....  I've gone to the ER several times, the ER docs tells me, my thyroid is causing my symptoms, but my tests always reveal normal function, I'm confused.  One doc said I may be hypo and another said hyper.Can someone have an enlarged goiter, with thyoid symptoms, although tests reveal normal function ?  Can symptoms be treated with meds, although test reveal normal function ?Doctor will not prescribe medications because my thyroid function is normal, but I feel miserable, hardly have any energy, always shaky, etc....  Seems I bounce back/forth between hyper/hypo.Thanks for any help.
title: New to thyroid
